titles: The baths of Bathe: or, A necessary compendious treatise concerning the nature, vse and efficacie of those famous hot vvaters published for the benefit of all such, as yeerely for their health, resort to those baths: with an aduertisement of the great vtilitie that commeth to mans body, by the taking of physick in the spring, inferred vpon a question mooued, concerning the frequencie of sicknesse, and death of people more in that season, then in any other. Whereunto is also annexed a censure, concerning the water of Saint Vincents rocks neere Bristoll, which begins to grow in great request and vse against the stone. By To. Venner, Doctor in Physick in Bathe.
author: Venner, Tobias, 1577-1660.
publisher: Printed by Felix Kyngston for Richard Moore, and are to be sold at his shop in Saint Dunstans churchyard in Fleetstreet,
notes: Engraved portrait of author inserted after A1.
Also issued as part 2 of STC 24645: Tobias Venner. Via ad vitam longam, second edition, enlarged, published in 1628.
Reproduction of original in the Central Library (Bristol, Eng.).
keywords: Mineral Waters --  England --  Early works to 1800.
Bath (England) --  Description and travel --  Early works to 1800.
